titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Reuben Fenner habeas corpus writ and affidavit 1977.418
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:40:47 +0000.

did.unittitle: Reuben Fenner habeas corpus writ and affidavit
did.abstract: This collection consists of a writ of habeas corpus and an affidavit addressed to Lieutenant Colonel Forbes, commander of the 42nd Regiment of the New York State Militia at Fort Lewis in New Utrecht, Kings County, regarding the release of Reuben Fenner, who enlisted under age. The documents are dated October 14, 1814.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Reuben Fenner habeas corpus writ and affidavit, 1977.418, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
